member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.EdgeInspect.CogBeadInspectPattern.SmoothingFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of consecutive calipers used (during training) to compute the average values of the the trained path.
member.exception: The supplied value is less than 1.

remarks.para: This property only supports float value type precision; up to 5 decimal places (such as 0.00001) can typically be expected to be maintained. Further precision can be assigned but will be lost (truncated).
Refer to the remarks for the definitions of bead paths and defects.

This is a sliding window of calipers. For a given caliper detecting a bead along the coarse path, that caliper along with a number of its neighboring calipers as specified by this property are used to determine the averaged value to train such as for bead width or bead coverage (see the
properties for more details as to the averaged values that are calculated and checked against). These averaged values will be used when attempting to locate defects in a runtime image.

A larger smoothing factor allows for a looser tolerance for certain aspects of the bead path at runtime. A higher value for this property is advised when some amount of variance for the bead along the path at runtime is expected and considered to be acceptable.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.EdgeInspect.CogBeadInspectPattern.CaliperSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the spacing between caliper center-points, along the chosen coarse bead path. Since there is no empty space between neighboring calipers, this value is also the height of each caliper. The height is measured perpendicular to the "width", which is measured across the bead (from one edge to the other).
member.exception: The supplied value is less than 1 or greater than 100.

remarks.para: This property only supports float value type precision; up to 5 decimal places (such as 0.00001) can typically be expected to be maintained. Further precision can be assigned but will be lost (truncated).
Refer to the remarks for the definitions of bead paths and defects.

The calipers described by this property will be used at runtime for the detection of defects by sampling the bead along the trained path. A larger value for this property results in fewer calipers along the bead path while a smaller value will result in more calipers. Note that a large value means that smaller defects may be missed. A high value can be useful in avoiding false positives if valid defects are expected to always cover a large section of the bead path.

This property respects any scaling present in the
of the . The value used should account for any scaling being applied.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.EdgeInspect.CogBeadInspectPattern
member.summary: Class that represents a BeadInspect pattern. You can use the methods of this class to find coarse path candidates for training, to train a new path, and to detect defects in a runtime image.

remarks.para: A BeadInspect pattern must be found (using the method) before it can be trained, and must be trained (using the method) before it can be used to detect defects in a runtime image.

The pattern contains parameters that affect the finding process and and also parameters that affect the training process. The parameters that affect finding are all contained in the
property while the training parameters are contained directly in the pattern. If you change any of these parameters on a trained pattern object, the pattern will automatically untrain itself. This ensures that the features of a trained pattern are in sync with the parameters that created them.

Once trained, this pattern encapsulates the exact shape and position of the path that is expected at runtime. Any differences between the path trained here and the path inspected in the runtime image will be flagged as defects when the
method of the pattern is called. Note that execute expects the runtime path to be at exactly the trained position, it does not "search" for the path within a region.

A "bead" can be visualized as a thick line; an elongated region of near-uniform intensity. The center line of this bead is known as the "bead path" and the perpendicular distance between the bead edges is known as the "bead width".

A "bead path" is a sequence of adjacent points within an image where a bead can successfully be located (within a tolerance for small gaps or variances such as the size of the bead). A path will often form a closed loop, but this is not a requirement. A bead path has a start and end point as well as a direction that goes from the start point to the end point along the path.

A "coarse path" is a bead path that has been generated by a find operation. If desired, you can edit the coarse path (to eliminate any blemishes) and then refine it using the method. The resulting "trained path" is smoother and more accurate than the coarse path. It also contains information about the width of the bead along this smoothed path. The trained path is read-only and cannot be edited. It can be used at run-time to detect defects.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.EdgeInspect.CogBeadInspectDefect.Bounds
member.summary: Gets the bounding box of the defect. The bounding box length is defined by the euclidean distance between the first and last points within the segment of the bead path where the defect is present. The bounding box height is defined by the largest bead width within the segment of the bead path where the defect is present. This box is specified in units defined by the space selected by the image's .

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.EdgeInspect.CogBeadInspectDefect.Area
member.summary: Gets the area of the bead path where the defect was detected. The area is defined by summing the bead widths within the defect. This area is specified in units defined by the space selected by the image's .
member.remarks: In cases where a caliper is missing one or both edges and no fill edges have been inserted, that caliper is considered to have an area of zero.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.EdgeInspect.CogBeadInspectDefect.Size
member.summary: Gets the length of the path between the first and last points along the segment of the bead path where the defect was detected. This length is specified in units defined by the space selected by the image's .

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.EdgeInspect.CogBeadInspectRunParams.DestroyMaskAndFillLists
member.summary: Destroys the existing MaskList, RightFillList, and LeftFillList. After this call, the three properties will return null.
member.event: Fires when this method changes the , , and/or properties of the RunParams. The following state flags may be affected:

remarks.para: Before masks or fill edges may be used, their lists must be initialized using a , which ensures that the lists are correctly synchronized with the actual number of calipers. When interacting with a new training result (typically because the Pattern has just been retrained), it is required that the lists be recreated if the number of calipers has changed. If the number of calipers has not changed, then recreating the lists is not required, but a review is advised to ensure that their positions still meet expectations. Failure to recreate the lists when required will result in a runtime error until new lists are generated or the current lists are destroyed.
Attempting to access the elements or call the methods of an that has been destroyed by a call to will result in an ObjectDisposedException.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.EdgeInspect.CogBeadInspectRunParams.CopyMaskAndFillLists(Cognex.VisionPro.EdgeInspect.CogBeadInspectRunParams)
member.summary:
Copies the MaskList, the RightFillList, and the LeftFillList from the given , without changing the size of the existing lists in this object. The lists from the given
are truncated, or extended with "false" values, to fit within the existing lists.
member.event: Fires when this method changes the , , and/or properties. The following state flags may be affected:
member.param: The run params whose masks and fill edges will be copied.
member.exception: is null.
member.remarks:
If the existing lists in this object have a different size than those in , here is what happens:
If the lists in are longer, only the initial portion of those lists is copied.
If the lists in are shorter, the full lists are copied, and then the copies are extended (at the end) with Boolean "false" values.
If the lists in are null, they are copied as if they contained the correct number of Boolean "false" values.
If the existing lists in this object are null, there is no effect. No copying occurs.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.EdgeInspect.CogBeadInspectRunParams.StepThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum relative amount an edge position can deviate from neighboring edges. It is specified as a fraction of average bead width at that location. A low value means a closer match and a high value means more tolerance.

remarks.para: This property only supports float value type precision; up to 5 decimal places (such as 0.00001) can typically be expected to be maintained. Further precision can be assigned but will be lost (truncated).
The average bead width is computed at train time. It averages the bead width from a number of calipers. The number of calipers is specified by the train property.

member.exception: The supplied value is less than or equal to 0 or greater than 1.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.EdgeInspect.CogBeadInspectRunParams.CoverageMax
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum acceptable coverage, any coverage above this value can be a defect.

remarks.para: This property only supports float value type precision; up to 5 decimal places (such as 0.00001) can typically be expected to be maintained. Further precision can be assigned but will be lost (truncated).

The bead coverage is a ratio of the number of bead pixels found at runtime to the average number of bead pixels found at train time. A "bead pixel" is any pixel between the two bead edges that has the same polarity (dark or light) as the bead itself. Often, all of the pixels between the two bead edges are bead pixels, but there can sometimes be holes in the bead.

The average number of bead pixels is computed at train time for each caliper. This value is computed by averaging the number of bead pixels from neighboring calipers. The number of calipers to average is specified by the train property.

member.exception: The supplied value is less than or equal to 1 or greater than or equal to 10.
member.event: Fires when this property changes. The following state flag may be affected:

member.event: Fires when this property changes. The following state flag may be affected:

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.EdgeInspect.CogBeadInspectRunParams.CoverageMin
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum acceptable coverage, any coverage below this value can be a defect.

remarks.para: This property only supports float value type precision; up to 5 decimal places (such as 0.00001) can typically be expected to be maintained. Further precision can be assigned but will be lost (truncated).

The bead coverage is a ratio of the number of bead pixels found at runtime to the average number of bead pixels found at train time. A "bead pixel" is any pixel between the two bead edges that has the same polarity (dark or light) as the bead itself. Often, all of the pixels between the two bead edges are bead pixels, but there can sometimes be holes in the bead.

The average number of bead pixels is computed at train time for each caliper. This value is computed by averaging the number of bead pixels from neighboring calipers. The number of calipers to average is specified by the train property.

member.exception: The supplied value is less than or equal to 0 or greater than or equal to 1.
member.event: Fires when this property changes. The following state flag may be affected:

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.EdgeInspect.CogBeadInspectRunParams.ConsecutiveFailingCalipersMin
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum number of consecutive failing calipers for a defect to be reported. Indirectly this property determines the length (along the bead) of the smallest reported defect.
member.remarks:
The bead inspection operation uses calipers to detect edges and performs tolerance checking on each caliper edge. The calipers are laid down side by side along the bead with no offset between them. The caliper length along the bead is specified by the train property.
The bead inspect tool process the image in 2 phases: the first phase is all about calipers, and the second phase is all about defects.
Caliper processing consists of the following:
Lay down the calipers to detect edge pairs. This step uses the ContrastThreshold and AbsoluteDistanceThreshold to determine which edges are considered for scoring.
Then the scoring procedure chooses the best pair of edges based on:
Pair width
Edge positions
Consistency with neighboring edge positions
After all of this, defects are detected using any of the (five) enabled tolerances of this class (and maybe some non-enable criteria, like, are any edges missing).
A defect is reported for any sequence of ConsecutiveFailingCalipersMin (or more) calipers where all of the individual calipers are deemed out of tolerance
The average bead width is computed at train time. It averages the bead width from a number of calipers. The number of calipers is specified by the train property.
member.exception: The supplied value is less than 1 or greater than 10.
member.event: Fires when this property changes. The following state flag may be affected:

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.EdgeInspect.CogBeadInspectRunParams.AbsoluteDistanceThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum absolute amount an edge position can deviate from a trained edge position. It is specified as a fraction of the average bead width.
member.remarks:
This property only supports float value type precision; up to 5 decimal places (such as 0.00001) can typically be expected to be maintained. Further precision can be assigned but will be lost (truncated).
The average bead width is computed at train time. It averages the bead width from a number of calipers. The number of calipers is specified by the train property.
A low value for this tolerance means that both edges of the bead must appear very close to where they were in the training image. A high value means that both edges can drift considerably from their trained location.
member.exception: The supplied value is less than or equal to 0 or greater than 2.
member.event: Fires when this property changes. The following state flag may be affected:
member.value: Default value is 0.5 (half the bead width).

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.EdgeInspect.CogBeadInspectRunParams.ContrastThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum contrast required for detecting the edges of the bead.
member.remarks:
This property only supports float value type precision; up to 5 decimal places (such as 0.00001) can typically be expected to be maintained. Further precision can be assigned but will be lost (truncated).
The contrast of an edge is the absolute difference in average pixel values across the edge. A contrast that is greater than the value you specify is considered an edge.
member.exception: The supplied value is less than 1 or greater than 255.
member.event: Fires when this property changes. The following state flag may be affected:

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.EdgeInspect.CogBeadInspectRunParams
member.summary: Class that holds the BeadInspect run parameters. These parameters control how BeadInspect detects defects in the runtime image.

remarks.para: The parameters in this class define the acceptable tolerances for a bead. The tolerances can be enabled or disabled, and a defect will be reported if the bead is outside any enabled tolerance.

The bead inspect tool process the image in 2 phases: the first phase is all about calipers, and the second phase is all about defects.
Caliper processing consists of the following:
Lay down the calipers to detect edge pairs. This step uses the ContrastThreshold and AbsoluteDistanceThreshold to determine which edges are considered for scoring.
Then the scoring procedure chooses the best pair of edges based on:
Pair width
Edge positions
Consistency with neighboring edge positions
After all of this, defects are detected using any of the (five) enabled tolerances of this class (and maybe some non-enable criteria, like, are any edges missing).
A defect is reported for any sequence of ConsecutiveFailingCalipersMin (or more) calipers where all of the individual calipers are deemed out of tolerance

An instance of this class must be provided as an argument to the
method of the class. The Execute() method is called automatically every time you call the method of the class, causing the tool to inspect the bead path in the
for defects.
For more information on the definition of a bead and bead path in this context, please refer to the remarks section of the class.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.EdgeInspect.CogBeadInspectTrainResult.CreateTrainResultGraphics(Cognex.VisionPro.EdgeInspect.CogBeadInspectTrainResultGraphicConstants,Cognex.VisionPro.EdgeInspect.CogBeadInspectRunParams,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates and returns a collection of graphics that depict the trained calipers. The graphics can be augmented with information from the mask, right fill, or left fill lists of the given . The desired graphics are specified by the given .
member.param: A value created by ORing together one or more values from .
The that will provide the mask and fill lists to be used when creating the requested graphics. If this argument is null, the mask and fill lists from the SuggestedRunParams will be used instead.

If true, this method will throw an exception when the number of boolean elements in the mask or fill lists of the provided does not match the number of trained calipers in this train result. Otherwise, only the mask or fill list elements that exist will be used.
member.returns: A filled with the requested graphics.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.EdgeInspect.CogBeadInspectTrainResult
member.summary: Class that holds a BeadInspect train result. An instance of this class is created by every successful call to the method.

remarks.para: The train result holds a smoothed path that represents the center line of the trained bead. A sequence of s is laid out along this path and these calipers are used at runtime to inspect for defects in the bead. The number of calipers trained, and their positions along the path, are part of the train result.
The train result also provides a "suggested" set of . These RunParams are tuned for the trained path, and might be a useful starting point for runtime defect inspection.
For more information on the definition of a bead or path, please refer to the remarks.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.EdgeInspect.CogBeadInspectFindParams.StartCircle
member.summary: Gets or Sets the start circle. The center of this circle is used as a starting location by the pattern's method.
member.value: The start circle. Default value is a circle with center at (0,0) and a radius of 100.
member.event: Fires when this property changes. The following state flags may be affected:

remarks.para: The start circle should be placed such that both edges of the bead are within it and that the center of the circle is as close to the middle of the bead as possible. The tool's attempts to find the bead edges may extend slightly past the circle edges, but you should not rely upon this behavior. For best results, you should set the circle diameter to be 10% to 30% wider than the bead.
Please see the method remarks section for more details on how the path finding is performed. See the remarks for definitions of "bead" and "path".
The StartCircle should not be mistaken for a region; it defines a starting point rather than the area over which a find operation will take place.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.EdgeInspect.CogBeadInspectFindParams
member.summary: This class holds the parameters used to find coarse paths in a training image.

remarks.para: Instances of this class are held by the property of a object. You can call the pattern's method to locate coarse paths in the of that pattern. Calling will automatically use the contained instance of this class to control how the paths are found.

If any properties of this class are changed, the containing pattern will discard all coarse paths held by that pattern and the pattern's property will return false. This will also untrain the pattern if it was previously trained.
For more information on the definition of a coarse path in this context, please refer to the remarks section of the class.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.EdgeInspect.CogBeadInspectDefectTypeConstants
member.summary: Enumeration of defect categories that can be detected within a runtime image by the BeadInspect Tool.

remarks.para: For more information on the definition of a bead and bead path in this context, please refer to the remarks section of the class.

Coverage as used in the context of this enumeration describes how consistent the contrast of the bead is when compared to the trained bead. For example, a dark bead on a light background that has a small section of high intensity within it that did not exist within the trained bead path would be considered an Underfill defect.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.EdgeInspect.CogBeadInspectDefectTypeConstants.NoBeadFound
member.summary: No bead was located.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.EdgeInspect.CogBeadInspectDefectTypeConstants.MissingLeftEdge
member.summary: The left-hand bead edge along the direction of the bead path could not be located.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.EdgeInspect.CogBeadInspectDefectTypeConstants.MissingRightEdge
member.summary: The right-hand bead edge along the direction of the bead path could not be located.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.EdgeInspect.CogBeadInspectDefectTypeConstants.MissingBothEdges
member.summary: Both bead edges could not be located.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.EdgeInspect.CogBeadInspectDefectTypeConstants.AboveStepThreshold
member.summary: One or both located bead edges deviate from their corresponding same-side previous bead edges along the direction of the bead path by an amount above what is allowed by the step threshold tolerance.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.EdgeInspect.CogBeadInspectDefectTypeConstants.TooWide
member.summary: The located bead is above the tolerance set for maximum width of the bead.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.EdgeInspect.CogBeadInspectDefectTypeConstants.TooNarrow
member.summary: The located bead is below the tolerance set for minimum width of the bead.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.EdgeInspect.CogBeadInspectDefectTypeConstants.Overfill
member.summary: The located bead is above the maximum tolerance set for consistency of coverage.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.EdgeInspect.CogBeadInspectDefectTypeConstants.Underfill
member.summary: The located bead is below the minimum tolerance set for consistency of coverage.
